flowchart
Class Module

java.lang.Object
  flowchart.Module
public class Module
extends java.lang.Object

An instance of a Module consists of zero or more instances of Procedure, which are held in a Map.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: June 8, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

          The name of this module.
private  java.util.Map procSeq
          A map of procedures.

Field Detail

name

private java.lang.String name
The name of this module.

procSeq

private java.util.Map procSeq
A map of procedures. The name of a procedure is used as a key. The type of each element in the map is Procedure.

Constructor Detail

Module

public Module(java.lang.String moduleName)
Constructor for a new module.

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of this module.
Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get the name of this module.

Returns:
The name of this module.

add

public Procedure add(java.lang.String pname)
Add a new procedure to this module.

Parameters:
pname - The name of the new procedure.
Returns:
The newly added Procedure instance.

get

public Procedure get(java.lang.String pname)
Get a procedure in this module.

Parameters:
pname - The name of the procedure.
Returns:
The Procedure instance denoted by pname.

count

public int count()
Get the number of procedures in this module.

Returns:
The number of procedures in this module.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Check if the module is empty.

Returns:
True if this module is empty.

show

public void show()
Display the flowcharts of all procedures in this module. The list of procedures is shown with a JList in the left column (navigation area) of the window. The flowchart of the selected procedure is shown in the workspace area.
